content.description: This low traverse is the best way to experience the warm-ups on this side of the boulder.
content.protection: A couple of pads, or a spotter and one pad, or don't fall, or go ahead and fall and get your shoes dirty.
content.location: Start as for The Good Stuff, and traverse to finish on Up and At Em.

climbs.name: Up High Down Low Too Slow

content.description: Start on the Momento Arete' traversing up and right into high Five.
Grab some big holds and go straight for the top.
content.location: Just about dead center on the trail side of the Warm Up Boulder.

content.description: Climb the little dihedral.  Not super memorable, but not offensive either.
content.location: The dihedral on the trail side of the boulder.

content.description: The sit-down start to the classic dyno "high Five" Starting on the sloped crimps just below high five, pull up and secure the start holds to high five, finish at the lip.Â
Far left problem on the trail side of the warm up boulder.  Good rock, safe landing.

A milder, though scarier version of Momento.  Old English should be tried at least once by everyone that visits the ranch.  You'll find the crux is going to the decent holds at the top, so keep your feet under you all the way to the finish!   It's just good fun, and maybe a little spicy, depending on your predilection.
content.protection: At least a couple of pads, and a spotter in front of the widow-maker rock near the base.
content.location: Just around the corner from Momento, on the left side of the trail as you walk away from the ranch houses.  Look for the other big, blunt arete., with the pointy rock about wait tall near the base.

content.description: Cryptic, slopey, balancy, and a little odd.  You won't need a gun license to manage this one (ie: "Do you have a license for those guns?"), but it just may test your technical skills.     Expect fun movement and creative climbing.  A couple of the moves require heavy sloper use, so this one tends to be a bit harder in the sun.
content.protection: One pad with spotter.  Two pads alone.
content.location: Obvious blunt arete visible from the trail as you come up to the Warm Up Boulder.

content.description:
Formerly known as 'The Puddle Project'.

 Start standing with the left hand on a small crimp in the obvious horizontal gash at 6 feet. Pull onto the wall and do a rising traverse rightwards following the line of weakness. This leads you to a stance on some smears at 6 feet with your right hand on a small sidepull, on the blunt arete feature. At this point angle leftwards to an assortment of holds at 14 feet. This section is the technical crux, involving some tiny holds for your feet and hands. Upon reaching these holds, move leftwards to what is probably the most difficult move physically. A few decent holds lead to the final crux, a tricky and committing move high off the deck to gain a decent crimp just below the top.

 A proud and aesthetic line, with some very technical movement on high quality rock. Expect to burn through some shoe rubber as you figure this one out.

 A more direct line seems like it might work, but it's going to involve some comp style skills or the ability to do a very improbable single leg squat. I spent some time on it, but couldn't quite put it together.
content.protection: You'll want a decent number of pads for this one. The landing is flat, but it's pretty tall, with a tricky and committing section at the top. It also meanders a bit, so you need pads to cover a large area.
content.location: Located about 40 feet to the left of 'Old English' on the same boulder. This is the obvious highball slab.

content.description: Grab the little fellas halfway up the wall, paste the feet, and throw for the lip.  Great fun!     Simple, elegant, and aesthetically pleasing.
content.location: To the right of Momento.  Look for the short wall with the chalked crimps in the middle of the face.

content.description: Start sitting, and climb up and left to the top-out.
content.location: The rightmost problem on the trail side of the Warm up boulder.

content.description: Start Up and at 'Em (V1) and traverse left on small crimps and move to large pocket.
content.location: Warm Up Boulder. Boulder is right on main trail.

content.description: Traverse starting on Old English across the typically mossy slab into Memento.The climbing is a bit wacky, involving the splits, a hand foot match, and strange barn door. If you like weird traverses, this is for you. There may be alternate beta as I didn't use all the possible holds on the slab. Grade is a guess since it's strange climbing.The full traverse from Old English into Up High, Down Low, Too Slow is awaiting an ascent. The last great line in Arkansas.
content.protection: 2 pads for Memento, pad or slider for the traverse
content.location: Start Old English and find your way to the Memento start; finish Memento

content.description: Warm Up Boulder holds several good warm-ups and variations(<v2), as well as the classics: Old English, v3, Momento, v5, and High Five, v4.
